channel.title: React on Signal's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in React on Signal's Blog

item.title: React Notes
item.description: JSX JSX (JavaScript XML) is a syntax extension for JavaScript commonly used in React to describe what the UI should look like. SHOW CODE React import './App.css' const welcome = { greeting: 'Hey', title: 'React' }; function getName(name) { return name; } function App() { return ( <div> <h1>{welcome.greeting} {welcome.title}!</h1> <h1>I am {getName('Signal')}!</h1> <label htmlFor="search">Search: </label> <input id="search" type="text"></input> </div> ) } export default App List Rendering Rendering a List in React is a common task when dealing with dynamic or repeated data.
